scenarioDescription:
The 17 Sco Exoplanetary System


Overview

17 Sco is a star with 1.22 times the mass of the Sun, and 25.92 times its radius. It is located 407.54 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 5.13 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

17 Sco is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 17 Sco system


17 Sco b

17 Sco b was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory, in 2020-12, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.45 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 17 Sco b is 1373.760 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 17 Sco b is 12.900 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 17 Sco b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system 17 Sco, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Lick Observatory.
name: 17 Sco - System With 1 Exoplanet
